title: INVENTORY / LIBRARY CARD
description: dead working class husband library card

dialogueTree.title: A Folded Library Card: "The library card is folded into two..."
dialogueTree.text: The library card is folded into two and still slightly wet to the touch. The front side reads: "Central Jamrock Public Library Card. Issued to Billie Méjean, expires July '53."

links.title: Logic: "Billie is a unisex name. Could be t..."
links.text: Billie is a unisex name. Could be the deceased *or* his family member?

links.title: A Folded Library Card: "Whoever owns this card is an avid r..."
links.text: Whoever owns this card is an avid reader: you find a list of books written in blue pencil: 'Radiothriller', 'Stand a Little Less Between Me and the Sun'. The last one in the list is 'The Glinting Curve', by M. Thibault. A library stamp indicates that the book has been returned.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Most of these titles seem to be in..."
links.text: Most of these titles seem to be in the sci-fi genre. Some thrillers too.

links.title: A Folded Library Card: ""If lost, please return the card to..."
links.text: "If lost, please return the card to the library. Dial 005-02-55-211 or visit us at Meroe Street 78, Jamrock. Business hours: 09.00 to 18.00."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." He takes a note. "We should..."
links.text: "Good." He takes a note. "We should give them a call from my Kineema, see if we can learn anything about Billie Méjean."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Good idea. There was plenty of info..."
links.text: Good idea. There was plenty of information here to go by.

links.title: A Folded Library Card: "Something tells you you should give..."
links.text: Something tells you you should give them a call.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We already decided to let the stat..."
links.text: "We already decided to let the station handle this case, so there's no need for us to call the library."

links.title: Logic: "You already decided to let the stat..."
links.text: You already decided to let the station handle the case, so there's no need to call the library.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should first decide what to do..."
links.text: "We should first decide what to do with the body, before taking any other actions. Let's take another look at the body and talk things through."

links.title: Logic: "You should first decide what to do..."
links.text: You should first decide what to do with the corpse, before taking any further actions. Talk to the lieutenant about it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good, we've examined the library c..."
links.text: "Good, we've examined the library card -- that should be enough for our colleagues. Now we can call the station from my Kineema and hand over the case."

links.title: A Folded Library Card: "You put the library card away."
links.text: You put the library card away.
